results.title: When the flood comes
results.brief_description: The Newcastle floods of 2007 have caused Djibril Ly to reflect on growing up in Mauritania in West Africa. He recalls the devestation of flooding and how this has helped him to prepare for similar events in Australia.

results.title: When the dust settles = et la Poussiere retombe
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Louise Johnson and Barrie Angus McLean
results.brief_description: This delightful seven minute film is designed to entertain and educate children about effective ways to deal with conflict. The film conveys its message through neighbouring parties of gophers; one community is being harassed by another group of gophers thoughtlessly throwing dirt at their fellow creatures.

results.title: When the day breaks
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, David Verrall, Wendy Tilby and Amanda Forbis
results.brief_description: This is the tale of Ruby, the pig. Ruby is lead to look for affirmation in the city around her after she witnesses the accidental death of a stranger. The film displays the directors’ use of pencil and paint on photocopies, which give a textured look, suggestive of a lithograph or a flickering newsreel. Winner of the Palme d’or - Best Short Film 1999 Cannes International Film Festival.

results.title: When the day breaks
results.brief_description: A chicken man and a pig woman bump into each other setting off a chain of events. 2001 Annecy Winner. One of the most affecting animated films of recent times. A story that highlights the things that connect us.

results.title: When the clouds roll by
results.creator_credit: Sterling Educational Films, Paul Killiam and Saul J. Turell
results.brief_description: By far the best of the action-filled frolics that made Douglas Fairbanks, popular before his swash-buckling period, this film pokes fun at psychiatry in a manner that is still modern. Full of comedy and thrills and dominated by Fairbanks’ breezy personality, we see the star in some truly astounding acrobatics.

results.title: When should grown ups help? the Vassar studies - studies of normal personality development
results.creator_credit: Vassar College, Dept. of Child study
results.brief_description: Shows pre-school children in various situations, in some of which they require help from adults and in others manage successfully by themselves. Points out that sometimes help is necessary for the child to succeed in projects undertaken, and at other times it is important for adults not to impose their standards of speed or efficiency. Presents four scenes without comment, suggesting that the audience decide in which of these episodes the children should have been helped.
results.title_for_label: When should grown ups help? the Vassar studies - studies of normal personality development

results.title: When quiet came
results.creator_credit: Bill Flowers and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Bill Flowers tells his story of how he was captured by the Japanese and sent to Changi as a POW. His tale is one of survival. Bill was in the 2/9th Field Ambulance during World War II. This digital story was recorded as part of In Our Words : Stories from Victorian Veterans digital storytelling workshop
results.description: Bill Flowers tells his story of how he was captured by the Japanese and sent to Changi as a POW. His tale is one of survival. results.title: When polar bears swam in the Thames
results.brief_description: To many people the Ice Age is a vague concept belonging to the remote past but geologically it was yesterday. Extraordinary evidence of the Ice Age continues to crop up on the British landscape in lion and hippopotamus fossils in Trafalgar Square, bear and hyena fragments in Devon, fossil remains of a polar bear from Kew. So when polar bears swam in the Thames, did Britain really look like present day Greenland?
results.title_for_label: When polar bears swam in the Thames
